subject: Great Game...
event:
... but the bad guys won.

Arrrgh.

Life is meaningless and has no purpose.

comments.article:
I was waiting for this post. :-)

They are still in the playoffs, y'know. And, Eli looked really good for about 2.75 quarters. In a row, even.

If Eli plays like that in the playoffs, there is hope yet.

Although I will cackle if the Chargers get to New England and beat the Evil Empire and dance on the logo at midfield.

Memory serves me, Noo England has a pretty good At-Home record, so I don't see the Chargers doing anything of any importance.

Then again, this is just mindless supposition on my part, ho ho.

Saint Dharma
comments.subject: If...

comments.article: I thought there was hope in the first half.

Hey, at least the Giants are still in the playoffs. Eli did look quite good for a stretch there.

You've still got hope for a Super Bowl rematch.

comments.upictitle: Rose Fox: booklust reading green books
comments.article: Don't encourage him to start a new series until he finishes the current one!

Great game but the bad guys won. We all love and miss you George.

Jaime says Spurs won 6-4. ;)
It was expected, at least it wasn't a rout. Though, with all the injuries they took playing the way they did, it lends to the question whether they should have played as they did.

Before I begin..thanks for the awesome books! I love your writing. You rock!

But I'll I admit I created a LJ account for a singular purpose. And that purpose is as follows:

AHAHAHAHAHAHA GO PATS! AHAHAHAHA UNBEATEN! PERFECT! AGAINST YOUR GIANTS!

It must be kind of sad to lose..I wouldn't know about that this season Mr. Martin! I can only imagine the intense anguish and despair that this loss has provided for you, Mr. Martin. This is particularly sweet after all of the Pats-bashing you've done. Hopefully you are comforted knowing that FIFTEEN OTHER TEAMS have experienced the same sad feelings that you are wrapped in now.

Now on to the Super Bowl! Good luck facing the Bucs! Maybe the Pats will see you later! (and that's a stretch) But look on the bright side..Eli Manning finally looked like a passable quarterback tonight! until he exploded in the fourth quarter...

Life has plenty of meaning and purpose! (when you're a pats fan!)

Okay but seriously. I'll freely admit that you have valid reasons for disliking them. Forgive this fan for sticking with his team through thick and thin. If the Giants can play with the heart they showed tonight in the playoffs then they will be very dangerous. Eli Manning cannot carry a team on his shoulders like Tom Brady or Peyton Manning can.. but he is not a detriment to the team as some have said. You also have a talented defensive line that is very capable of disrupting offensive flow, which masks the secondary's problems. Good luck in the postseason! Seriously!

Please pardon the gloating session! And let me say again that I love your books and can't wait for the sequels!
comments.subject: Hello, Mr. Martin!

comments.article: Technically shouldn't it be 12 other teams? :P
comments.subject: Re: Hello, Mr. Martin!

comments.article:
George, I knew you'd say that when I heard the result, which is why I have some advice for you:

Start following cricket. Specifically, the Australian cricket team, which just completely [b]spanked[/b] the Indian team in the Boxing Day Test Match, making for their fifteenth straight Test win.

If you pin some of your hopes to the Aussie cricketers, you'll always have something to be cheered up by at this time of year. :)

Hmmm, a football game lasts for approx. 3.5 hours, and a cricket match can last for 5 days.

As it is, people are annoyingly complaining about him taking his "taking too long" with A Dance of Dragons. I can already see 100s of them jumping off bridges if he took up being a cricket fan.

Maybe he should follow cricket.

I saw the score and knew you'd post, Mr. Martin. Sorry about that. At least it was a close game.

And hey, it could be worse. You could be a Cubs fan. ::snarls at lousy stinking lost chance at the pennant AGAIN this year::

--Kris

comments.upictitle: A Very Friendly Asshole: NEVER FORGET
comments.article: Both teams were awesome. Such heart.

comments.upictitle: Storm Damage: This goes out to all my peeps!
comments.article:
Great Game...
... but the bad guys won.

Arrrgh.

Life is meaningless and has no purpose.


You might as well kill off Arya, now.

+ 1

It's time to kill Arya, yeaahh!

It was a well-fought game, and I admit I wanted to see NE go undefeated if only to be able to smirk at friends from Miami who love to brag about the Dolphins being undefeated in 1973.

But as a determined and unrepentant Redskins fan, I did have to give a little whoop of glee at the Giants losing.

But hey, your team's still in the playoffs. At least till they get to Lambeau.

Well, fooey - I was counting on your guys! Bad enough the Dolphins no longer hold sole title to the record but having to hold it with a rival from the AFC East makes it even worse!

Good luck in the playoffs.

Life is hard...

But that's dealt with the 1934 and 1942 Bears.

Onward into the playoffs!
Life is freaking grand.
They're not perfect, yet.
comments.subject: Careful...

comments.article: The Giants played in a way that should leave fans feeling proud, at least through about three quarters. It unravelled, yet, but they made the Pats work for their win. Good on them.

comments.upictitle: OMG, it's a talking biscuit named Mara!: Nature-Redwood path
comments.article:
Life is meaningless and has no purpose.

Well, duhhhh.....

:)

Possibly the best game Eli's ever played.

People are going to blame the loss on that pick but come on -- the Giants pass defense had just one sack.

It's weird. I had a dream last night that the Giants had won, so I've spent the entire morning with the belief that the Pats were 15-1 and that all my neighbors were sad. Sometimes dreams seem so real.

Go Patriots!

I don't even like football, but, you know, home town team and all.

My husband is a devout Raider fan and I am a Buccaneer fan (going to the game today).  Neither of us cares for the Patsies.  My husband has been doing his own private research about the referees... did you know the Pats get the same ref'ing crew for most of their games?  Other teams get a mixed bag of refs.  Hubby has the stats, but basically, that's it in a nutshell.  Nuff said?!?!
comments.subject: Interesting info

comments.article: I'm not a Pats fan (Broncos and Chiefs) and I find that implication insulting.
comments.subject: Re: Interesting info

comments.article:
"And Darkness and Decay and the Red Death held illimitable dominion over all."

Go Patriots!

Damn you George... every time I hear that the Giants and/or the Jets lost, I now jokingly say "Life is meaningless and has no purpose" :)

Don't worry, it's almost January. Life goes back to painless mediocrity soon enough.

I hosted an end-of-the-year party yesterday, all day, and I warned people at the beginning that I would be watching the game last night. Of all of my friends, I am the only die-hard football fan. However, we are all GRRM fans, and we all wanted life for you to be meaningful and full of joy.

It was a great game, though.

comments.upictitle: electorprince: Love: The Red Font Edit
comments.article:
Filthy Patriots, grandstanding already and they haven't even made it through the playoffs yet. "Perfection" is incumbent upon a Super Bowl ring at the end, girls; your quest is still incomplete, but I'll grant you'll cheat your way through teams far better than you.

Justice will be seeing the Patriots lose in the second round of the playoffs while Belichick gets a pink slip from the NFL for being scum-rot. Maybe then my faith in a God who actually cares would be restored.

There is not a single team that they played this year that is better than them. The only team even close would be a healthy Colts team. With Dwight Freeney out, that defense is not nearly as scary.

Some of the games were much closer than they should have been. Baltimore is a great example of a bad teams playing above their level against the Patriots (Losing a few weeks later to the Dolphins!?!).

The whole cheating scandal is so blown out of proportion because of the Patriots success. Other teams (if not all of them) have been accused of these type of things, and just have not been fully brought to light. Perhaps it was in the Pat's case due to Mangini wanting to taint their image. They have been watched all season long, and will continue to be watched.

As a Pat's fan, I have no problem admitting that Belichick is not a likable man, but he is damn good at what he does. It just so happens that success will draw attention, and due to bitter opponents, often enough it's negative. The players on the Pat's have accomplished some amazing feats and people can't stomach to give credit where credit is due.

Tom Brady and the Patriots play 60 minutes at the top of their game, which is often just not the case for their opponents.
